text.sentence: Financial Services | U.S. Large Cap Banks twenty two July two thousand fifteen
Bottom Line: A sound quarter and incremental revenue/efficiency initiatives were overshadowed by a push out of its ROTCE target and the near term overhang of a potential RBS sale near term.
Relative to our forecast, a lower than expected loan loss provision and controlled expenses helped offset a lower than forecast net interest margin and modestly lower than anticipated fee income.

While the company unveiled a new dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn revenue and efficiency initiative, it will not be enough to overcome the challenging rate environment as it pushed out its fourQsixteen target of a ten percent ROTCE.
Still, key metrics in twoQfifteen showed continued improvement, while its guidance points to further progress into threeQfifteen.
Also yesterday morning CFG filed an initial S one covering a secondary offering for RBS and a separate S one for the issuance of sub debt.
We believe the secondary could approach dollar threebn, reducing RBS's stake from forty percent to twenty percent .
Excluding net drag of dollar .five from restructuring charges EPS was dollar .forty.
In addition to earnings, it announced incremental revenue and efficiency initiatives, named Top II, targeting dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn in enhancements by two thousand sixteen.

Drivers: Relative to oneQfifteen, results evidenced a larger balance sheet, a lower net interest margin, higher fee income coupled with relatively stable core expenses, solid credit quality, and a reduced tax rate and share count .
Estimates: Following twoQfifteen results, we are maintaining our twoHfifteen EPS estimate at dollar .eighty

Still, we are also lowering our two thousand sixteen estimate by dollar .fifteen to dollar two.five reflecting the outlook for lower rates partially offset by recently announced revenue and efficiency initiatives.

Price USD twenty six.seventy two Price Target USD twenty seven.

We expect its ROTCE to increase towards ten percent in two thousand sixteen through: one) increased revenues with targeted initiatives in its Consumer and Commercial segments; two) impact of rising rates; three) cost reduction efforts; and four) capital actions.
Our dollar twenty seven price target implies thirteenx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar two.five.

Assuming interest rates rise faster than anticipated and it achieves its revenue growth initiatives earlier than expected, we could see two thousand sixteen EPS moving towards dollar two.twenty five with the same thirteenx multiple implies a dollar twenty nine upside.
If interest rates stay lower for longer and it is unable to execute on capital actions according to plan, we could see the stock trade back to tangible book value or dollar twenty four.

A sound quarter and incremental revenue/efficiency initiatives were overshadowed by a push out of its ROTCE target and the near term overhang of potential RBS sale near term.
Relative to our forecast, a lower than expected loan loss provision and controlled expenses helped offset a lower than forecast net interest margin and modestly lower than anticipated fee income.

While the company unveiled a new dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn revenue and efficiency initiative, it will not be enough to overcome the challenging rate environment as it pushed out its fourQsixteen target of a ten percent ROTCE.
Still, key metrics in twoQfifteen showed continued improvement, while its guidance points to further progress into threeQfifteen.
Also yesterday morning CFG filed an initial S one covering a secondary offering for RBS and a separate S one for the issuance of sub debt.
We believe the secondary could approach dollar threebn, reducing RBS's stake from forty percent to twenty percent.
Following twoQfifteen results, we are maintaining our twoHfifteen EPS estimate at dollar .eighty

Still, we are also lowering our two thousand sixteen estimate by dollar .fifteen to dollar two.five reflecting the outlook for lower rates partially offset by recently announced revenue and efficiency initiatives.
We still expect CFG to achieve its ten percent ROTCE goal, just not by fourQsixteen.
In addition to earnings, it announced incremental revenue and efficiency initiatives, named Top II, targeting dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn in enhancements for two thousand sixteen.
Also, it filed an initial S one covering a secondary offering for RBS and a separate S one for the issuance of sub debt.
Its pro forma Basel III tier one common ratio was eleven.eight
In early April it completed a dollar two hundred fiftymn preferred stock issuance and ten.fivemn common stock share repurchase, further reducing RBS ownership interest to forty.eight
interest margin, higher fee income coupled with relatively stable core expenses, solid credit quality, and a reduced tax rate and share count.
Commercial net charge offs were dollar sevenmn in twoQfifteen, compared to commercial net recoveries of dollar twenty twomn in oneQfifteen.
trajectory and partially mitigate some of the impact of the persistent low rate environment, slower build in fee based business and lower net interest margin.
These initiatives include further steps to improve efficiency, as well as opportunities to drive revenue growth through more focused and effective customer cross sell and retention strategies.

Total: It's targeting a pre tax benefit of dollar ninety dollar one hundred fifteenmn, including dollar fifty dollar sixty fivemn on the revenue side and dollar forty dollar fiftymn on the expense front.
Efficiency: Operations transformation and procurement Pricing: Commercial Lending/Treasury Services Revenue Enhancement: Consumer distribution channel and Commercial and Consumer
the decline in the forward Fed Funds curve from about one hundred seventy fivebp when originally planned to one hundred tenbp currently.
We do not believe this was unexpected as benefits from the forward yield curve accounted for close to forty percent of its estimated pre tax net income expansion through two thousand fifteen.
It plans to provide two thousand sixteen guidance in January two thousand sixteen.

percent ) ; two) net interest margin broadly stable/may have bottomed ; three) positive operating leverage though modest expense growth due to investments tied to growth initiatives; four) stable asset quality trends; five) provision expense to continue to normalize ; six) no additional restructuring costs ; and; seven) Bthree Tier one common equity ratio of eleven.seventy
five percent and ninety seven percent ninety eight percent loan to deposit ratio.
continues to maintain a highly asset sensitive balance sheet position, and expects a two hundredbp rise in rates would benefit net interest income by six.eight percent in the first year .
This is driven primarily by the short end of the curve.
common stock share repurchase, further reducing RBS' ownership interest to forty.eight
Separately, CFG filed two S one's yesterday morning along with earnings.

The first S one outlined a secondary offering of a nominal dollar one hundred tenmn of shares from RBS. Note, in its prior secondary offering, the initial S one cover noted dollar one hundredmn of shares however, the amended S one filed thirteen days later was for dollar three.threebn .

We also note it is RBS' stated goal to deconsolidate its CFG stake which implies an ownership level of thirty five percent though it may not receive full regulatory capital relief until its ownership level is below twenty percent .
As such, we believe another dollar threebn or so offering is possible near term.
The second S one filed on July twenty onest was for its planned
Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. issuance of dollar two hundred fiftymn in subordinated notes which will likely be used to fund common stock repurchases.
additional day in the quarter, offset by a reduction in the net interest margin.
loan yields, mix and fees, onebp from investment premium amortization and onebp of higher deposits costs.
percent, driven by broad based growth across both consumer and commercial in every category.
two percent while cost of interest bearing deposits increased twobp and cost of borrowings rose fourbp to one.forty
capital markets, trust and investments, and service charges increased, while other, mortgage and FX/trade finance declined.
the sale of a dollar two hundred seventy threemn portfolio of conforming loans partially offset by higher origination volume.
a dollar fifteenmn decrease in compensation expense was partially offset by a dollar twelvemn increase in outside services.
Its ongoing efficiency initiatives continued to help fund reinvestments in the business.
compared to dollar thirty twomn, or three percent, increase in oneQfifteen.
The entire NPA decrease was driven by NPLs, as OREO were unchanged at dollar thirty eightmn.
Retail NPLs fell dollar fifty threemn to dollar nine hundred sixty twomn, driven by H/E, while commercial NPLs declined dollar thirty threemn to dollar one hundred twenty sixmn
Consumer · Net income gained dollar fivemn, or eight percent, to dollar sixty onemn .
Net interest income rose two.one percent and fee income gained five percent .
Expenses rose dollar seventeenmn to dollar five hundred ninety sixmn while its efficiency ratio was seventy nine.three
In oneQfifteen it sold dollar one hundred fourteenmn of commercial leases and purchased dollar four hundred sixteenmn auto loans and dollar two hundred twomn of student loans.
Its gain on sale margin was two.eighteen percent, down forty seven bps.
Commercial · Net income declined eight percent to dollar one hundred thirty fivemn .

We, Jason M. Goldberg, CFA and Brian Morton, CFA, hereby certify that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect our personal views about any or all of the subject securities or issuers referred to in this research report and no part of our compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.
Barclays Research is a part of the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC and its affiliates .

For current important disclosures regarding companies that are the subject of this research report, please send a written request to: Barclays Research Compliance, seven hundred forty five Seventh Avenue, fourteenth Floor, New York, NY ten thousand nineteen or refer to http://publicresearch.barclays
dot com or call two hundred twelve five hundred twenty six one thousand seventy two.

The analysts responsible for preparing this research report have received compensation based upon various factors including the firm's total revenues, a portion of which is generated by investment banking activities.

Analysts regularly conduct site visits to view the material operations of covered companies, but Barclays policy prohibits them from accepting payment or reimbursement by any covered company of their travel expenses for such visits.
In order to access Barclays Statement regarding Research Dissemination Policies and Procedures, please refer to https://live.barcap
In order to access Barclays Research Conflict Management Policy Statement, please refer to: https://live.barcap
The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Primary Stocks Citizens Financial Group Inc., Equal Weight/Positive, A/C/D/J/K/L/M Disclosure Legend: A: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has been lead manager or co lead manager of a publicly disclosed offer of securities of the issuer in the previous twelve months.
B: An employee of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a director of this issuer.
C: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker and/or liquidity provider in equity securities issued by this issuer or one of its affiliates.
D: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
E: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment banking services from this issuer within the next three months.
F: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate beneficially owned one percent or more of a class of equity securities of the issuer as of the end of the month prior to the research report's issuance.
G: One of the analysts on the coverage team owns shares of the common stock of this issuer.
H: This issuer beneficially owns five percent or more of any class of common equity securities of Barclays Bank PLC.
I: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has a significant financial interest in the securities of this issuer.
J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate trades regularly in the securities of this issuer.
K: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received non investment banking related compensation from this issuer within the past twelve months.
L: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, an investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
M: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
N: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
O: Barclays Capital Inc., through Barclays Market Makers, is a Designated Market Maker in this issuer's stock, which is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

At any given time, its associated Designated Market Maker may have long or short inventory position in the stock; and its associated Designated Market Maker may be on the opposite side of orders executed on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in the stock.

P: A partner, director or officer of Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has, during the preceding twelve months, provided services to the subject company for remuneration, other than normal course investment advisory or trade execution services.
Q: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a Corporate Broker to this issuer.
R: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
S: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. is a market maker in an equity or equity related security issued by this issuer.
T: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is providing equity advisory services to this issuer.
U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non voting restricted shares.
Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Large Cap Banks Ally Financial Inc. Capital One Financial Comerica Inc. Huntington Bancshares M and T Bank PNC Financial Services Gp SunTrust Banks Wells Fargo Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand six hundred eighty eight companies under coverage.

forty three percent have been assigned an Overweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Buy rating; fifty four percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

forty one percent have been assigned an Equal Weight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Hold rating; forty six percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

fourteen percent have been assigned an Underweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Sell rating; forty three percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.
Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

Valuation Methodology: Our price target is dollar twenty seven and equates to thirteenx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar two.five.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: The company's ability to achieve a ten percent ROTCE by the end of two thousand sixteen is dependent on a rising interest rate environment.
If rates do not rise as anticipated over that time frame, achieving this target would be challenging.
percent owned by RBS which is expected to continue to wind down its position.
